medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. A had been stable since his last inpatient admission 18 months prior. Symptoms included auditory hallucinations of voices, feelings of being targeted by his mother, and physical aggression stemming from a dispute over cigarettes, culminating in an assault on his mother. He did not follow up with psychiatric care after his last hospitalization.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior diagnoses include conduct disorder and developmental learning disorder. He had multiple psychiatric admissions starting at age 16, with a notable episode of self-harm at age 25. First hospitalization at age 27 due to bizarre behavior and catatonia.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for low intellectual functioning in both his mother and brother. His mother had a low IQ score in the 50s. His brother experienced complications at birth and demonstrated significant delays in cognitive development.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in an impoverished environment with mother and brother. Past involvement with law enforcement for unarmed robbery and other offenses. Occasional use of alcohol and illicit drugs, with primary history of marijuana use.
